tag-1: Citi Handlowy Supports Return of 19th-Century Art to National Museum in Warsaw
tag-2: Warsaw – On Monday, March 3, 2014, the National Museum in Warsaw received drawings and lithographs by outstanding 19th-century Polish artists. Forty-two works, lost during World War II, have been recovered by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs with the support of the Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy. The ceremonial hand-over was conducted by representatives of both institutions at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs headquarters.
tag-3: Citi Handlowy was represented by Slawomir S. Sikora, Citi Country Officer for Poland, who spoke on the importance of cooperation of public and private institutions in the field of national heritage, one of main focuses of the activities of the Kronenberg Foundation, the Bank's Corporate Social Responsibility arm. He referred to the long tradition and history of Citi and Citi Handlowy and their commitment to local values. He also stressed that national heritage is one of the fundamental values that shape national identity.
tag-4: Boguslaw Winid, Deputy Foreign Affairs Minister, spoke and thanked Citi's Country Officer for Poland for supporting the Ministry and "engaging in a complex operation."
tag-5: The event was attended by Malgorzata Omilanowska, Deputy Minister, Ministry of Culture and National Heritage; Dariusz Jadowski, Head of Education Department, National Bank of Poland; and Prof. Slawomir Ratajski, Secretary General and representative of the Polish Commission for Unesco.
tag-6: The collection consists of priceless drawings and lithographs by the most famous Polish 19th-century Polish artists such as Juliusz Kossak, Aleksander Orlowski, and Leon Wyczólkowski. All of these works, along with other exhibits from the museum's collections, were taken out of the country in 1944.
tag-7: Citi Handlowy, through the Kronenberg Foundation, has once again participated in the Under the "Recovery of Polish Art" program. Previously, the Kronenberg Foundation, in cooperation with Ministry of Culture and National Heritage, returned to the country two missing artworks by Wojciech Gerson and Anna Bilinska-Bohdanowiczowa.
